searchexample.html

This is an example page that uses the Google Search API. The code (except for this comment block), was copied from the Google Page on the subject.
See also:
http://code.google.com/apis/ajaxsearch/documentation/#The_Hello_World_of_Google_Search

http://code.google.com/apis/ajaxsearch/documentation/

http://code.google.com/apis/ajaxsearch/documentation/#fonje

00001 <!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
00002 <html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
00003   <head>
00004     <title>My Google AJAX Search API Application</title>
00005     <script src="http://www.google.com/jsapi?key=ABQIAAAAEmJBx7wui2me6l65B9cbGxSgpExuB0qMRQJK1CqbTmGBEUmrHxTWS-jq0HtIRjmBHjux30WT0zQnaQ" type="text/javascript"></script>
00006     <script language="Javascript" type="text/javascript">
00007     //<![CDATA[
00008 
00009     google.load("search", "1");
00010 
00011     function OnLoad() {
00012       // Create a search control
00013       var searchControl = new google.search.SearchControl();
00014 
00015       // Add in a full set of searchers
00016       var localSearch = new google.search.LocalSearch();
00017       searchControl.addSearcher(localSearch);
00018       searchControl.addSearcher(new google.search.WebSearch());
00019       searchControl.addSearcher(new google.search.VideoSearch());
00020       searchControl.addSearcher(new google.search.BlogSearch());
00021 
00022       // Set the Local Search center point
00023       localSearch.setCenterPoint("New York, NY");
00024 
00025       // Tell the searcher to draw itself and tell it where to attach
00026       searchControl.draw(document.getElementById("searchcontrol"));
00027 
00028       // Execute an inital search
00029       searchControl.execute("Google");
00030     }
00031     google.setOnLoadCallback(OnLoad);
00032 
00033     //]]>
00034     </script>
00035   </head>
00036   <body>
00037     <div id="searchcontrol">Loading...</div>
00038   </body>
00039 </html>
